summary: I OWN A 1997 CHEVROLET VENTURE WITH 71000 MILES. THAT HAS BEEN MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE OWNERS MANUAL. VAN STARTED TO OVER HEAT, TOOK IT TO THE DEALER AND WAS TOLD THERE WAS ENGINE DAMAGE DUE TO COOLANT IN THE CYLINDER AND ENGINE OIL. A LEAKY MANIFOLD GASKET IS THE SUSPECTED CAUSE. THIS APPEARS TO BE A PREVALENT PROBLEM WITH THIS MANUFACTURES 3.4L ENGINE.  *JB
